items.preText:
All set for the start. Spin straightaway. Shakib Al Hasan to start off and Masakadza on strike. Zimbabwe have handed an ODI debut to Brandon Mavuta. For Bangladesh, Anamul Haque will play his first ODI since the 2015 World Cup. Alright, scratch all that. Brendan Taylor IS playing. Apologies for the all the confusion. Here are the XIs - Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Anamul Haque, 3 Shakib Al Hasan, 4 Mahmudullah, 5 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 6 Nasir Hossain, 7 Sabbir Rahman, 8 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 9 Rubel Hossain, 10 Sunzamul Islam, 11 Mustafizur Rahman Zimbabwe: 1 Hamilton Masakadza, 2 Solomon Mire, 3 PJ Moor (wk), 4 Brendan Taylor, 5 Craig Ervine, 6 Sikandar Raza, 7 Malcolm Waller, 8 Graeme Cremer (capt), 9 Kyle Jarvis, 10 Tendai Chatara, 11 Blessing Muzarabani 11.30 am Bangladesh have won the toss and have decided to bowl

Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza, as he has often done, is backing his fast bowlers to make an impact. And considering conditions are far from usual in Dhaka, cold and foggy, the new ball may well be the most decisive factor in the game. Zimbabwe might be pleased if that is indeed the case, especially with Kyle Jarvis returning to the fold. He's nagging with his lines, has a gorgeous outswinger, and has played a lot of cricket in England, on a Kolpak deal that only just expired

11.20 am Over at the Under-19 World Cup in New Zealand, Bangladesh have begun their campaign with two wins in two matches. In the first, captain Saif Hassan struck a six-laden 84 to clinch the game. In the second, that only just got done, Towhid Hridoy has smashed 122 off only 126 balls to sink Canada.

Tamim: "Shakib will bat at 3 today but i still prefer Mushi to bat at number 3, he is the best batsman in our team and he should bat high! "

Biswajit : "Spin attack will be key factor for BD. ZIM faces troubles with spins every time. If they overcome it, it will be a good fight. "

Hafiz: "@Biswajit: I would prefer sporting pitch instead of truly spinning pitch. BD needs to get used to these kind of pitch. We saw what happens in recent SA and last year NZ tour."

Atol: "It is 12 am in New York, waiting to see my fav BD roaring tigers, who are much sharper and brighter than before. "

In a couple of days' time, Mirpur will go down in history as one of only five stadiums to host 100 ODIs. Here is Mohammad Isam on the place which saw Bangladesh's splendid transformation.

Hafiz: "What a tournament! Three coaching member of the same team from recent past is now head of three different countries fighting in tri-nation tournament." ---- I count Hathurusingha, former Bangladesh coach, now with Sri Lanka. Heath Streak, former Bangladesh bowling coach, now with Zimbabwe. Who's the third?

Dulitha : "The third is Thilan Samaraweera" --- Ah right, batting coach with Sri Lanka.

Jason has clearly kept himself up to date: "Come on Zim!! Underdogs, but you can do this!"

Mim_ER_Jamai: "Staying up all night to watch this game. It better worth. "

11.00 am Hello and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's ball-by-ball coverage of the first ODI between Bangladesh and Zimbabwe. It's been a long time since ODI cricket was in this part of town. Fifteen months, to be precise. And on a wintry day - yep, it's cold down here in the subcontinent - international cricket's middle-weight division is about to get it onnnnnnnn!

Hafiz: "Eagerly waiting to see Fizz in action! Hope Zim will give good fight and it will be cracking start of new season for BD"

TAMIM KABIR: "Although after 15 Months cricket is back in BD but the condition will be rather like England, who know how much the ball seam around!!!"
items.text: pushes at a wide delivery outside off and gets an inside edge backward of square leg
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Masakadza, 1 run

items.text: loops one up around leg and it comes on with the arm to drift down the leg side. Mire tries to clip but gets beaten because of how sharp the drift is. Loses shape and loosely takes the backfoot out of the crease and the keeper whips the bails off
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Mire, 1 wide, OUT

dismissal.text: SF Mire st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (0b 0x4 0x6)

items.text: non-turning fullish delivery outside off, puts the bat forward and gets beaten on the outside edge
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Ervine, no run

items.text: catching practice to midwicket. Two in the opening over for Bangladesh. Loops up a half-volley that angles in around middle and off and Ervine chips the clip straight into the hands of midwicket
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Ervine, OUT

dismissal.text: CR Ervine c Sabbir Rahman b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

items.text: full and sliding on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, 2 runs

items.text: sliding down the leg side again and he keeps the bat inside the line after turning around for a flick
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, 1 wide

items.text: comes forward and defends and gets an inside edge into the on side
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, no run
Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, no run

items.preText: Spin from both ends right at the start. Sunzamul  Islam, the left-arm spinner.
items.text: slight spin away from the right-hander, defended off the outside of the bat into the off side
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, no run

items.text: full around off, defended into the off side
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, no run

items.text: flighted up on middle, driven out
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, no run

items.text: stays back to a length ball that straightens aroud middle and defends back
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, no run
Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, no run
Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, 2 runs

items.text: loopy, curves in around middle, driven out to wide long-off
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, 1 run

items.text: goes for an extravagant drive to a delivery that drifts into him and inside-edges it to the back pad
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Masakadza, no run

items.text: tossed up around off, driven to wide long-off
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Masakadza, 1 run

items.text: drifts it down the leg side as it curves into him
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, 1 wide

items.text: good length, stays back and defends off the inside of the bat down the pitch
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, no run

items.text: full around off, driven through the extra cover region
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Taylor, 1 run

items.text: pitched up on off, driven down to long-off
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Masakadza, 1 run

items.text: full, slid into middle, driven to wide long-off for one
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, 1 run

items.text: length ball, straightens around the middle-stump channel and finds the outside of the bat to backward point
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Taylor, 1 run

items.text: stays back to a length ball, it's an arm ball and rushes him and he finds the inside edge
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, no run

items.text: too short from the bowler. Rocks back and heaves a pull through the cow corner region
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Masakadza, FOUR runs
